Understate: The claim may understate the fact that users must opt in to the COVID-19 exposure tracking feature on their phones.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Google and Apple have put a COVID tracker on every phone.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the COVID tracker is present on every phone without providing evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the new settings on phones, such as the COVID-19 exposure logging feature aimed at helping contact tracers.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that personal information like location data will not be shared by the COVID tracker.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Google and Apple have implemented the COVID tracker on every phone.
